meanings.definition: To be thrifty or frugal in spending money.
meanings.sent1: She was scrimping on groceries to save money for a vacation.
meanings.sent2: He always scrimps on unnecessary purchases to build his savings.
meanings.sent3: The family joked that Dad was the king of scrimping when it came to buying gifts.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to scrimping every penny eventually paid off in a new car.
meanings.sent5: Scrimping on daily expenses allowed her to afford a dream trip.

meanings.definition: To economize or save money by cutting back on expenses.
meanings.sent1: After scrimping on utilities, they managed to reduce their monthly bills.
meanings.sent2: They were scrimping on dining out to save up for a home renovation.
meanings.sent3: The couple's scrimping on date nights led to creative and fun at-home activities.
meanings.sent4: Scrimping on office supplies felt like a game of financial strategy.
meanings.sent5: Their scrimping on unnecessary luxuries allowed them to invest in their future.
